title: Long-term Effects of India's Childhood Immunization Program on Earnings and Consumption Expenditure: Comment. (arXiv:2401.11100v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: Summan, Nandi, and Bloom (2023; SNB) finds that exposure of babies to India's Universal Immunization Programme (UIP) in the late 1980s increased their weekly wages in early adulthood by 0.138 log points and per-capita household consumption 0.028 points. But the results are attained by regressing on age, in years, while controlling for year of birth--two variables that, as constructed, are nearly collinear. The results are therefore attributable to trends during the one-year survey period, such as inflation. A randomization exercise shows that when the true impacts are zero, the SNB estimator averages 0.088 points for wages and 0.039 points for consumption.

translated_title: 印度儿童免疫计划对收入和消费支出的长期影响：评述
translated_abstract: Summan、Nandi和Bloom（2023；SNB）发现，晚期八十年代印度婴儿接受印度通用免疫计划（UIP）的暴露使其早期成年时的周薪增加了0.138个对数点，人均家庭消费增加了0.028个点。但这些结果是通过回归年龄和出生年份这两个变量得出的，而这两个变量构造时几乎是共线的。因此，这些结果可以归因于一年调查期间的趋势，如通货膨胀。随机化实验表明，当真实影响为零时，SNB估计器的平均值为0.088个点（工资）和0.039个点（消费）。
tldr: Summan, Nandi, and Bloom发现，印度通用免疫计划对婴儿的免疫暴露对其成年后的周薪和人均家庭消费有正向影响。然而，他们的研究结果可能受到年龄和出生年份这两个相关变量的影响，且可能与调查期间的趋势相关。
en_tdlr: Summan, Nandi, and Bloom found that exposure to India's Universal Immunization Programme (UIP) during infancy has positive effects on weekly wages and per-capita household consumption in early adulthood. However, their results may be influenced by the collinearity between age and year of birth variables and may be related to the trends during the survey period.
